Interface EventRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<GameEvent,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<GameEvent,Integer>

  • Method Details

    • beginningOfGameExists

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM GameStatus t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.type = 0") int beginningOfGameExists(Game game)
      Return the number of GameStatus objects that have a type of 0 and a game of the given game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game that the status is for
      Returns:
      The number of GameStatus objects that have a type of 0 and a game that matches the game passed in.

    • getBeginningOfGame

      @Query("SELECT t FROM GameStatus t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.type = 0") List<GameStatus> getBeginningOfGame(Game game)
      This function returns a list of GameStatus objects that are associated with a specific game and have a type of 0
      Parameters:
      game - The game that the status is for
      Returns:
      A list of GameStatus objects that are the beginning of a game.

    • endingOfGameExists

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM GameStatus t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.type = 1") int endingOfGameExists(Game game)
      Returns the number of rows in the GameStatus table where the game is equal to the game passed in and the type is equal to 1.
      Parameters:
      game - The game that the status is for
      Returns:
      The number of GameStatus objects that have a type of 1 and a game of the given game.

    • interruptionExists

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM GameStatus t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.type = 2 AND t.eventDate BETWEEN ?2 AND ?3") int interruptionExists(Game game, Time eventMin, Time eventMax)
      Returns the number of Interruption events in a game
      Parameters:
      game - The game object that is being checked for an interruption
      eventMin - The minimum time of the event
      eventMax - The time of the event that is being checked for.
      Returns:
      The number of interruptions that occurred in a game.

    • resumeGameExists

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM GameStatus t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.type = 3 AND t.eventDate BETWEEN ?2 AND ?3") int resumeGameExists(Game game, Time eventMin, Time eventMax)
      "I want to know if there is a GameStatus record for a given game, with a type of 3, and an eventDate between two times."
      Parameters:
      game - The game object that is being queried
      eventMin - The minimum time of the event
      eventMax - The time of the last event in the game.
      Returns:
      The number of GameStatus objects that have a type of 3 and an eventDate between the eventMin and eventMax times.

    • yellowCardExists

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM Card t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.player = ?2 AND t.isYellow IS true") int yellowCardExists(Game game, Player player)
      Returns the number of yellow cards a player has in a game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game that the card is associated with
      player - The player who has the card
      Returns:
      The number of yellow cards a player has in a game.

    • redCardExists

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM Card t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.player = ?2 AND t.isYellow IS false") int redCardExists(Game game, Player player)
      Returns the number of red cards that a player has in a game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game that the card is in
      player - The player who is being checked for a card
      Returns:
      The number of red cards that exist for a given game and player.

    • getMostRecentEvent

      @Query("SELECT t FROM GameEvent t WHERE t.game = ?1 ORDER BY t.eventDate DESC") List<GameEvent> getMostRecentEvent(Game game)
      Get the most recent event for a given game.
      Parameters:
      game - The game to get the most recent event for.
      Returns:
      A list of GameEvents

    • getNextDayEvents

      @Query("SELECT t FROM GameEvent t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.eventDate < ?2 ORDER BY t.eventDate ASC") List<GameEvent> getNextDayEvents(Game game, Time begin)
      Get all events for a game that occur after a given time.
      Parameters:
      game - The game object that the events are associated with.
      begin - The time to start the query from.
      Returns:
      A list of GameEvents that are associated with the game and have an eventDate that is before the begin time.

    • getTodayEvents

      @Query("SELECT t FROM GameEvent t WHERE t.game = ?1 AND t.eventDate >= ?2 ORDER BY t.eventDate ASC") List<GameEvent> getTodayEvents(Game game, Time begin)
      Get all events for a game that occur after a certain time.
      Parameters:
      game - The game object that we want to get events for.
      begin - The time to start the query from.
      Returns:
      A list of GameEvents that are associated with the game and have an eventDate greater than or equal to the begin time.

    • playerYellowCards

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM Card t WHERE t.player = ?1 AND t.isYellow IS true") int playerYellowCards(Player player)
      Return the number of yellow cards a player has.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to get the yellow cards for
      Returns:
      The number of yellow cards a player has.

    • playerRedCards

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM Card t WHERE t.player = ?1 AND t.isYellow IS false") int playerRedCards(Player player)
      Return the number of red cards a player has.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to get the cards for
      Returns:
      The number of red cards a player has.

    • playerGoals

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(t) FROM Goal t WHERE t.player = ?1") int playerGoals(Player player)
      Return the number of goals scored by a player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose goals we want to count.
      Returns:
      The number of goals scored by a player.
